column4: hi all, can some bash wizard help me out? i want to recursively remove all files, except for the .svn folder, and except for one particular subfolder. someone did this for me before using find, but i don't remember how to do it now. thanks.
could just cp it out, empty the folder, then copy it back
there are many subfolders, so i'd prefer a script. + the .svn folder is hidden
doesnt matter if its hidden or not, all folders starting with . are hidden
